tips: Focus on vector spaces, eigenvalues, and determinants in Linear Algebra. For Calculus, master differentiation, integration, and applications in real-world problems.
Practice orthographic projections, isometric views, and sectional views. Get comfortable with CAD software like AutoCAD or SolidWorks
Understand polymers, corrosion prevention, water treatment, and electrochemistry. Solve previous year question papers to grasp key concepts
For Civil, focus on construction materials, structural analysis, and surveying basics. For Mechanical, grasp thermodynamics, fluid mechanics, and manufacturing processes
Focus on finite automata, grammars, pushdown automata, and Turing machines. Use JFLAP for visualization and practice problems regularly.
Master OSI & TCP/IP models, subnetting, routing, and protocols like HTTP, TCP, and UDP. Use network simulators like Cisco Packet Tracer for practice.
Focus on SQL, normalization, indexing, and transactions. Practice queries on MySQL or PostgreSQL and understand ER diagrams and ACID properties.
Learn assemblers, linkers, loaders, and compilers. Focus on OS interaction, memory management, and process scheduling concepts.
Understand automata, regular expressions, Turing machines, and complexity classes. Create mind maps.
Understand architecture, instruction sets, and interfacing. Focus on 8085, 8051, and ARM basics. Practice assembly language programming.
Learn disaster types, risk assessment, mitigation strategies, and recovery plans. Focus on early warning systems and emergency response.

Practice orthographic projections, isometric views, and sectional views. Get comfortable with CAD software like AutoCAD or SolidWorks
Understand polymers, corrosion prevention, water treatment, and electrochemistry. Solve previous year question papers to grasp key concepts
For Civil, focus on construction materials, structural analysis, and surveying basics. For Mechanical, grasp thermodynamics, fluid mechanics, and manufacturing processes
Focus on finite automata, grammars, pushdown automata, and Turing machines. Use JFLAP for visualization and practice problems regularly.
Master OSI & TCP/IP models, subnetting, routing, and protocols like HTTP, TCP, and UDP. Use network simulators like Cisco Packet Tracer for practice.

Learn assemblers, linkers, loaders, and compilers. Focus on OS interaction, memory management, and process scheduling concepts.
Understand automata, regular expressions, Turing machines, and complexity classes. Create mind maps.
Understand architecture, instruction sets, and interfacing. Focus on 8085, 8051, and ARM basics. Practice assembly language programming.
Learn disaster types, risk assessment, mitigation strategies, and recovery plans. Focus on early warning systems and emergency response.
Understand gradient, divergence, curl, and line/surface integrals. Practice problems on Green’s, Gauss’s, and Stokes’ theorems.
Focus on wave optics, quantum mechanics, lasers, and superconductivity. Solve numerical problems regularly.
Master free body diagrams, equilibrium, trusses, friction, and moment of inertia concepts.
Revise Ohm's law, Kirchhoff’s laws, AC/DC circuits, diodes, and transistors. Practice circuit problems.
Focus on syntax, loops, functions, arrays, pointers, and file handling. Write and debug your own code.
Learn set theory, logic, relations, functions, graphs, and combinatorics. Practice proofs and theorems.
Master arrays, linked lists, stacks, queues, trees, and graphs. Understand complexity and recursion.
Study Boolean algebra, logic gates, flip-flops, and combinational/sequential circuits.
Grasp classes, objects, inheritance, polymorphism, and encapsulation. Build real-world programs.
Understand ethical theories, engineering ethics, codes of conduct, and case studies.
Learn the design process, project planning, and evaluation techniques. Focus on creative thinking.
Focus on renewable energy, environmental impact, life cycle analysis, and green technologies.
Study trees, connectivity, Eulerian and Hamiltonian paths, and graph coloring.
Learn CPU organization, memory hierarchy, instruction cycles, and pipelining.
Understand ER models, normalization, SQL, indexing, and transactions.
Study process management, memory management, file systems, and scheduling algorithms.
Focus on lexical analysis, parsing, syntax trees, and code generation.
Study graphics pipeline, transformations, rendering, and image enhancement techniques.
Understand time complexity, greedy algorithms, dynamic programming, and backtracking.
Focus on data preprocessing, visualization, statistical analysis, and using tools like Python and R.
Understand micro and macroeconomics, trade policies, WTO, and industrial development.
Revise key subjects, focus on weak areas, and practice problem-solving across topics.
Study network models, protocols, transmission methods, and error detection techniques.
